action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: starting with a common five-letter word containing frequent vowels and consonants to gather initial feedback.
guess: crane

attempts = 1
target_word = viper
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<yellow> a<red> n<red> e<yellow>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<yellow> a<red> n<red> e<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: letters C, A, N are excluded. R and E are present but misplaced. Testing new positions for R (not 2nd) and E (not 5th), avoiding excluded letters. "tiger" places R in 5th (new position) and E in 4th, with common consonants T and G.
guess: tiger

attempts = 2
target_word = viper
guess = tiger
guess_feedback = t<red> i<green> g<red> e<green> r<green>

guess_feedback: t<red> i<green> g<red> e<green> r<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: confirmed letters I (2nd), E (4th), R (5th). Excluded letters include C, A, N, T, G. Possible structure: _ I _ E R. Testing "liver" as L and V are common unused letters fitting the pattern.
guess: liver

attempts = 3
target_word = viper
guess = liver
guess_feedback = l<red> i<green> v<yellow> e<green> r<green>

guess_feedback: l<red> i<green> v<yellow> e<green> r<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: confirmed letters I (2nd), E (4th), R (5th). V is present but misplaced (not 3rd). Possible structure: V I _ E R. Testing "viper" as P is a common unused consonant fitting the pattern.
guess: viper

attempts = 4
target_word = viper
guess = viper
guess_feedback = v<green> i<green> p<green> e<green> r<green>

guess_explanation: starting with a common five-letter word containing frequent vowels and consonants to gather initial feedback.

letters C, A, N are excluded. R and E are present but misplaced. Testing new positions for R (not 2nd) and E (not 5th), avoiding excluded letters. "tiger" places R in 5th (new position) and E in 4th, with common consonants T and G.
confirmed letters I (2nd), E (4th), R (5th). Excluded letters include C, A, N, T, G. Possible structure: _ I _ E R. Testing "liver" as L and V are common unused letters fitting the pattern.
confirmed letters I (2nd), E (4th), R (5th). V is present but misplaced (not 3rd). Possible structure: V I _ E R. Testing "viper" as P is a common unused consonant fitting the pattern.
